title: How to Build a Headache Rack

steps.title: Cut the top of the crossbar to the length of the top of your cap or on a 1991 Ford cut at 58 inches (147.3 cm).
steps.content: Cut the top of the crossbar to the length of the top of your cap or on a 1991 Ford cut at 58 inches (147.3 cm). [1] X Research source

steps.title: Cut two sides at 35 degrees at both ends going opposite directions at 23 inches (58.4 cm) in length.
steps.content: Cut two sides at 35 degrees at both ends going opposite directions at 23 inches (58.4 cm) in length. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tack where the sides angle out.
steps.content: Tack where the sides angle out. Take and check how it fits on the pickup truck.

steps.title: Cut two more pieces (21 inches long) to place on each side of your slider window.
steps.content: Cut two more pieces (21 inches long) to place on each side of your slider window. If there's no slider window, go 1/3 of the way in from each side.

steps.title: Cut your 1 1⁄2 inch (3.8 cm) x 1⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) flat strap into 4 x 6 inch pieces.
steps.content: Cut your 1 1 ⁄ 2 inch (3.8 cm) x 1 ⁄ 4 inch (0.6 cm) flat strap into 4 x 6 inch pieces.

steps.title: Tack the end pieces on to run with the bed flush to the front of the rack.
steps.content: Tack the end pieces on to run with the bed flush to the front of the rack. Take the other two pieces, center, and tack them running with the cab.

steps.title: Drill your hole in both rack bases and bed to line up and bolt.
steps.content: Drill your hole in both rack bases and bed to line up and bolt. [3] X Research source
